Component.Description:
This component allows to control a Wifibot 4G remotely via the embedded wifibot TCP server.

It provides a simple way to send commands to the Wifibot left and right motors, and retrieves periodically some standard sensors infos like battery level, odometers and infrared sensors data.

Property.Description: Set here the IP address of your wifibot.
Set here the port of the wifibot server running on the robot. (Refer to the wifibot documentation, usually 15000 or 15020).

Defines the way this component receives left and right motors commands on its input(s):
  • Vectorized: the component will have only 1 input and expects on it a vector of 2 integers with the left and right motor speeds (values from 0 to 60).
  • Left/Right separated: the component will have 2 inputs (left speed and right speed) and expects on each of them a scalar containing the required value for the corresponding motor (from 0 to 60).
Activates or not the closed loop speed control on the wifibot.

Period (in microseconds) at which the motors commands are sent to the wifibot. If the wifibot does not receive commmands in a certain period of time, it just stops. So this component periodically repeats the last known commands in case no new command has arrived in the specified period.

Output.Description:
Vector of 4 integers:
  • Front left wheel speed (0-40 ticks/41ms)
  • Rear left wheel speed (0-40 ticks/41ms)
  • Front right wheel speed (0-40 ticks/41ms)
  • Rear right speed (0-40 ticks/41ms)

Vector of 2 integers:
  • Left infrared sensor (0-150 cm)
  • Right infrared sensor (0-150 cm)

Input.Description: Speed value for the left motor.
Speed value for the right motor.
Vector of 2 integers containing the speeds for the left and right motors.
